title: Create compliance reports for ILMT-managed products
content:
The IBM License Metric Tool (ILMT) aims to help businesses keep an up-to-date inventory of software assets installed in their environments. SAM supports creating compliance reports based on ILMT-managed license consumption data. To do this, follow these steps:

  1. Run the Pull data from IBM License Metric Tool integration job.
    SAM collects ILMT license consumption data by leveraging the IBM License Metric Tool (ILMT)/BigFix Integration. Make sure you run the discovery job before synchronizing the product family from UD/UCMDB.
  2. Synchronize the product family.
    The product vendor must be IBM(ILMT).
  3. Maintain license compatibility matrix based on the publisher's official documentation. 
  4. Configure license rules.
    By default, both the PVU rule for IBM LMT solution and RVU rule for IBM LMT solution license rules are selected for ILMT-managed products, and the PVU rule is configured as the default license rule.
    In the product version list, you might find many records. The ones with the Production environment field set to true indicate that the products are actual deployments in your environment. The record using the product name and has the Production environment field set to false is created for calculating license consumption, so make sure you configure license rules for this record only.
  5. Build license pool information.
    When you configure license models to build the license pool, follow these steps:
    1. In the Software coverage section, select a license metric for the ILMT-managed product as applicable. Currently, SAM provides two OOTB license metrics for ILMT-managed products: RVU - IBM (ILMT) and PVU - IBM (ILMT). You can only select between these two metrics.
    2. Select a product version. Make sure you select the one with the product name because it's used for calculating license consumption. Don't select options with a specific product version.  
    For more information on the settings, see Software coverage.
  6. Calculate license consumption.
    • If the product has only one PVU rule configured, SAM takes this rule as the default license rule and calculates license consumption based on it.
    • If the product has only one RVU rule configured, SAM calculates license consumption based on the RVU rule.
    • If the product has both the PVU and RVU rule configured, SAM calculates license consumption based on the default PVU rule. To view the consumption result calculated based on the RVU rule, change the default license rule to RVU rule for IBM LMT solution from the Default value field.
    • Regardless of the consumption results based on the PVU or RVU rule, SAM by default presents the product compliance status for the sub-capacity. 
  7. View compliance status.
  8. Analyze compliance report.
